qas.question: What apps can one expect the People app to match with?
What apps can one expect the Photos app to match with?
What makes Windows Store apps unique?

answers.text: apps are to be optimized for touchscreen environments and are more specialized than current desktop applications.
collection of hooks to provide common functionality that can integrate with other apps

qas.question: What apps can't one expect the People app to match with?
What apps can't one expect the Photos app to match with?

plausible_answers.text: apps are to be optimized for touchscreen environments and are more specialized than current desktop applications

qas.question: What makes Windows Store apps un-unique?

plausible_answers.text: a collection of hooks to provide common functionality that can integrate with other apps

context: Windows 8 introduces a new style of application, Windows Store apps. According to <a0_0><b5_0>Microsoft developer<b5_0/><a0_0/> Jensen Harris, these <a3_0><b8_0>apps are to be optimized for touchscreen environments and are more specialized than current desktop applications<b8_0/>.<a3_0/> Apps can run either in a full-screen mode, or be snapped to the side of a screen. Apps can provide toast notifications on screen or animate their tiles on the Start screen with dynamic content. Apps can use "contracts"; <b9_0>a <a4_0>collection of hooks to provide common functionality that can integrate with other apps<b9_0/><a4_0/>, including search and sharing. Apps can also provide integration with other services; for example, the People app can connect to a variety of different social networks and services (such as <a1_0><b6_0>Facebook, Skype, and People service<b6_0/><a1_0/>), while the Photos app can aggregate photos from services such as <a2_0><b7_0>Facebook and Flickr<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
